metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1813 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
util-linux/mdev.c in BusyBox before 1.21.0 uses 0777 permissions for parent directories when creating nested directories under /dev/, which allows local users to have unknown impact and attack vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1
busybox-static - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1
udhcpc - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1
udhcpd - 1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> "low" because mdev doesn't easily support nested directories

criterions.comment: busybox package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.21.0-1ubuntu1').
